alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Nash; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 15 at 5:12PM EDT until August 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Wayne County in central North Carolina... Southwestern Nash County in central North Carolina... Wilson County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Johnston County in central North Carolina... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 511 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northwest of Fremont, or 14 miles northeast of Smithfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wilson, Elm City, Fremont, Bailey, Micro, Sharpsburg, Pine Level, Kenly, Lucama and Stantonsburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
